title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 30.1 - Mechanical recording of proceedings in justice courts
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 30.1 - Mechanical recording of proceedings in justice courts

State Regulations

The chief administrator of the courts may
require the mechanical recording of testimony and of other proceedings in cases
in a town or village justice court. The mechanical recording of proceedings in
accordance with this rule shall not affect the right of the court or any
litigant therein to employ a stenographer to take minutes of such proceedings
manually. Notes

30.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
